cab.content:
THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S government-- -!-1-TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this dooument.MOST SECRET.COPY NOW.M. (40) 21st CONCLUSIONS, MINUTE 13.Confidential Annex./23rd -Tanuary, 1939^7SCANDINAVIA.German importsof iron orevia Narvik.(previous reference:W.M.(40) 20thConclusions,Minute 10.THE SECRETARY OP LTATE FOR FOREIGN affairs said that he had been furnished by the Ministry ofEconomic Warfare with the following figures of Germanimports of iron ore via Narvik:-1958-91938Imports into ( Dec.Germany and 'Czechoslovakia1939Jan.Feb.March.349 Thousand tons.4804575741959-40Imports intoGreater Germany!1939.jl.940.110Jan.(lp"to15th only).140He proposed to ask for the figures to be checked, as they were different from those previouslyfurnished to the War Cabinet.
Treatment byGermany ofScandinavianShipping.(previous reference:W.M.(40) 20thConclusions,Minute 10).It was recalled that the War Cabinet had agreed on the previous day that the Secretary of Statefor Dominion Affairs should address a telegram to theDominions Governments setting out for their informationfull particulars regarding the treatment by GermanyScandinavian shipping, not only when trading withthis country, but also when engaged in trade withother parts of the world.THE SECRETARY OP STATE FOR DOMINION affairs said he had found that it would be more convenientthat he should read a carefully prepared statement tothe Dominion High Commissioners, the substance ofwhich -fikey would then telegraph to thcim Governments.He had taken action accordingly.The War Cabinet took note ofthe above statement.Richmond Terrace, S.W.1,
